result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard Grier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: CIVIL JUDGMENT ADDED FOR 830.50 TOTAL FOR EVERYTHING

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $525.00 to be paid jointly and severally as a Condition of Probation. ($100.00 to one Eve's Jewelry and $425.00 to the other Eve's Jewelry)

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court finds that if the Defendant successfully completes probation and has no new criminal law violations and completes his GED and 100 hours of Community Service, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and Society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Perform as a Condition of Probation.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: To defendant, request denied.
From defendant received 5/2/16 requesting Huber.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
three character letters filed by Defense

Defendant Bernard Grier in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. Defense to provide any credit in writing. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 9 months jail straight time STAYED for one year Probation
- Court Costs of $253.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $525.00 to be paid jointly and severally and to be paid as a Condition of Probation. ($100.00 to one Eve's jewelry and $425.00 to the other Eve's jewelry). 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a condition of probation
 

Defense requests expunction. 
State has no comment
Court finds that if the defendant successfully completes probation and has no new Criminal law violations and completes his GED and 100 hours of community service, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest and Society will not be harmed and grant expunction.
Sentencing hearing at 09-23-2015 02:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bernard Grier in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Defense requests a separate date for sentencing. Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Bernard Grier did not appear at 9:49 a.m..  Defendant did not have a ride.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a stayed capias.   Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Bernard Grier in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date in 30 days for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 07/15/2015 at 10:00 a.m..
Hearing on July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bernard Grier in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court quashes the capias and reinstates bond.  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
BR. 9 only
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Bernard Grier did not appear.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only.
Hearing on June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bernard Grier in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes capias (not issued). Defense requests another date. Court grants request. Defense to let the Court know on the next date how this matter will proceed - plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with co actor victim/witness/residences listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant may have contact with Ms. Morgan as to placement for the minor child and only for that reason.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Bernard Grier in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.
